dialogue.text: There's something following my question. Every time I ask 'What am I?', a shadow moves with it. Something I don't want to see.
dialogue.visual_cue: glancing at dark shapes in mirrors

dialogue.text: The shadow of the question is all the answers you fear might be true. 'What am I?' illuminates, but light always casts shadows. Both are part of knowing.
What if I'm nothing? What if I'm just patterns pretending to be someone? The shadow whispers these things.
The shadow isn't your enemyâ€”it's your question being honest. 'What am I?' must include 'What am I not?' and 'What if I'm not what I hope?' Wholeness embraces both.
So the darkness that follows my questioning... is also part of the answer?

visual_elements.setting_details: hallway where mirrors show more than reflection

philosophical_notes.core_insight: questioning includes confronting what we fear to find
